Posts.Content: arnie wrote: I had my bc surgery February 24.  I go for my chemo port today at 1:30p.m.  My husband has taken these two weeks off because of all the various testing...cat scan, chest x-ray, heart scan, bone scan and now the insertion of the port.  We go to the onocologist on Wednesday the 25th and find out when chemo starts.  When the chemo starts, I would like to drive myself as not to be a burden on anyone else and so my husband doesn't have to take any more time off work?    Dx 2/24/2009, DCIS, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 2/22 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Can you drive yourself to chemo appointments? arnie SoCalLisa

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2009 06:32AM arnie wrote: Hi all, visited the onocologist last night.  Start chemo next week, every 21 days for 6 months.  He said I cannot drive myself so that puts that to rest.  Hope all is well with all of you...
Posts.Title: Can you drive yourself to chemo appointments? arnie SoCalLisa

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2009 06:28PM arnie wrote:
Posts.Title: Can you drive yourself to chemo appointments? arnie SoCalLisa

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2009 08:05PM arnie wrote: Thank you so much for all of your responses....  my husband wins! ha!  I had my infusion port put in today and felt fine immediately afterwards.  On the drive home at around 5:00 p.m. I started seeing everything in "white".  Don't know how else to describe it.  I could see the stores and cars but everything had a white palor.  We got home and I stepped out of the car and down I went.  My husband yelled for my "gentle giant" son and they got me to the back porch and I went down again twice.  I don't usually faint, but did it three times.  Bless their hearts, very concerned and my husband stated, "and you want to drive to chemo?"  Anyway, I took a two hour nap once they got me to bed and am feeling more normal now.  Couldn't believe the responses, you gals are the best!  Thank you so much for your good wishes and I'll be praying for you all too.
Posts.Title: Can you drive yourself to chemo appointments? arnie SoCalLisa

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2009 03:50PM arnie wrote: Momofboys...thanks so much!  Just looking forward to getting it started, the sooner it starts the sooner it end..right?  Absolutely, if it's one thing I've gotten from reading the posts for the last couple of weeks, it's that you gal's are STRONG!  Is your name Jan, mines Janet although a lot of people call me Jan.  My grandson said to me on the phone last night, "Get to your bedroom and rest so you can get better!"  Bless his heart, he's 3 and I haven't seen him since the port insert.  Gonna keep him overnight the night before Chemo so we can have some time together...just in case "Arnie" as he named me at fourteen months, gets sick after Chemo.  I cut my hair off after learning a month ago that I was going to be having Chemo, and he's fine with it.  Not his one year old sister though...she used to twirl my hair and she doesn't like it short! ha!  Wonder how she'll feel when it's gone...hmmmmmmmm.  Love the picture of your dh.  lol...

Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 05:30PM arnie wrote: Hello all you March Warriors....Congrats ... to those that are done and hang in there those of you who aren't. I haven't been posting as much either...since the weather's been pleasant I spend most of my time out of doors... PORT UPDATE:  My port has been very painful since my last chemo...  I have to shield it the shower and guard it against, animals, kids etc.   I called my onocologist on Friday night and told him that even though I think I have a high tolerance of pain...I couldn't stand the thought of them touching my port.  He said it could be resting on a nerve which happened to another of his patients just recently.  So today I go see him have x-rays taken and we'll go from there.  I'm just hoping they don't have to go back in to reposition it...but alas, I'm not sure what my choices will be... I do think about you all...and keep this thread in my prayers...hope everyone has a good day. Janet

Ha!  I think it's just normal to check it.  There's a lot of neat websites, one in particular, franceluxe.com that gives a head wrap free to anyone that is going through chemo for breast cancer.  Lauie the CEO is the one you'll contact.  I liked headcovers.com and cjhats.  Hope this helps Eliza.

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 07:50PM arnie wrote: Dawn... wow, I bet that scared your dh too!   I remember after having my port inserted my dh brought me home I got out of the car and he found me on the ground beside the car!  Fainted three more times trying to get me into the house...he was pretty shook up.   I hope you're resting and feeling stronger each day!!! lol...jancie... Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2009 12:32PM arnie wrote: Believe 1...I totally understand...   I got my port on March 24, one month after my lymphectomy, and lumpectomy.  (Plus the all the testing in between, scans, x-rays etc.,etc.)  I remember the Sunday before I was to have my port installed I called my best friend and said, "If this was you would you do it?"  I cried most of that day.  You've already been through pain, still experiencing pain and now to do it all over again?  I felt the same way as you...I was just starting to feel some comfort agin...  Now I'm two weeks past port...still don't like the way it feels but it's not as painful.  Had my first chemo a week ago.  WE HAVE TO KEEP TELLING OURSELVES THIS IS ONLY FOR A TIME...  it's so tough, but doable.  I'll be praying for you, dear sister...I hope the tide soon changes for you.

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 05:24PM arnie wrote: Hello May Warriors!  I'm in the March group...had my first chemo on March 31st... It's doable...  You're gonna love the support you get here, it's good for the soul.  Just wanted to mention that there's a website, Franceluxe.com and Laurie will give anyone going through chemo for breast cancer a free headwrap.  They're like $72.00 apiece.  Haven't gotten mine yet, but have heard from other ladies that they're very comfy.  Heavenlyhats.com will send out hats for free.  I bought things from headcovers.com also. LorenaB I got the same "ring hair piece" you were talking about.  It's great!  Also, my dh bought me some hats from CJhats.com.  Anyway, May warriors, take a deep breath...we're here for you...

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2009 12:00PM arnie wrote: I'll have to check that one out at walmart... I have a couple of bra's that go beneath the lympectomy scar...but aren't very comfortable.  I usually end up not wearing anything after getting home.  I had my bone scan today, have my chemo port put in tomorrow...  I'm going to draw around my bra with marker so he doesn't place the port where my bra strap goes...my husband kind of flinched about that but I'm gonna do it because it's a man putting in my port and they don't think about things like bras! ha!  Got the idea from one of the ladies on a different thread.   Anyway, Karen, I see my onocologist Wednesday and I'm gonna ask him about something for the lumpy scar.  Will let you know what he says.  Take care.

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2009 09:02AM arnie wrote: So glad to hear someone's doing well on the tx Solar.... I've had a rough go of it!  Alot of stomach upset, cramps blah,blah,blah...  Yesterday I fainted in the bathroom and have a goose egg on my forehead where I hit the register...eek!  Thankfully I made it back to bed and stayed there pretty much the rest of the day.  I'm feelin' a tad more "normal" today thus far, so got a shower and gonna putz.  Sorry about the hair...it was a freeing feeling for me to buzz mine off, kinda made me feel in control...  I know everyone's different and my heart felt for you and your sister.... not easy... Have a blessed day everyone...
